item.description:
Report X-2023090232

  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO UNLOAD WEARING FULL PPE AND FOUND BOX WITH UPPER CORNER WET WITH FLAMMABLE LIQUID 3 LABEL. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET FOR A FLAMMABLE LIQUID 3 PACKAGE. NO LIQUID FROM PACKAGE ON FLOOR TO CLEAN UP, TRANSPORTED PACKAGE TO DMP AREA. RESPONDER REFERRED TO THE WASTE DISPOSAL CHART PRIOR TO PROCESSING THE DAMAGE THROUGH THE DMP.

  • Description: DURING INTRANSIT PORTION OF LOAD MOVEMENT PRESSURE BUILD UP DUE TO TEMPETURE AND PRODUCT MOVEMENT CAUSED PRV TO VENT SOME MATERIAL INTO DOME COVER AREA OF CTMV. RELEASE DISCOVERED BY DRIVER DURING UNIT INSPECTION ENROUTE. PRV RECLOSED AND RELEASE CLEANED PROPERLY. NO ADDITIONAL INCIDENTS AND MATERIAL UNLOADED SAFELY AT CONSIGNEE.

item.title: Report E-2023090588
item.description:
Report E-2023090588

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: HATFIELD
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 12, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon container of UN2922 was crushed during transit and released its full contents to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized absorbent pads, a sprayer, and a neutralizing solution to wipe down all freight and the impacted floor of the trailer and dock until the surfaces tested neutral and were sufficiently remediated. All spent absorbents and cleanup debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums. The one (1) damaged 5-gallon pail of product was placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All three (3) containers of waste were labeled appropriately and staged on-site.

  • Description: PACKAGE WAS FOUND OPEN IN THE DA/OVERGOOD PROCESSING AREA. DURING RETAPE, THE EMPLOYEE NOTICED 9 LITHIUM ION BATTERIES INSIDE OF THE PACKAGE AND THE OUTER PACKAGE HAD NO HAZARDOUS MARKINGS. THE EMPLOYEE CONTACTED THE HAZMAT AUDTOR TO FURTHER INVESTIGATE.

item.description:
Report E-2023090635

  • City: HAZLE TOWNSHIP
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Pitt Ohio Express
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: This drum arrived back to the origin terminal and was being moved onto another trailer. During this process, the drum was punctured by a forklift. The drum was immediately placed turned onto it's side to prevent further release and was then overpacked to contain the drum. The released material was neutralized and containerized for proper disposal. Due to the hazard of the material, the packaging specs could not be safely obtained.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded from trailer and QA was called over for a leaking hazmat. Associate went over to unload area, used protective gloves and placed package into hazmat container and brought package to QA. DescribePack: Box came to QA with top and bottom closure wet with liquid from inside box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed upright in hazmat container and brought to QA

item.title: Report X-2023081918
item.description:
Report X-2023081918

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment was taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Upon inspection on inner contents 1 X 3.79 liter plastic bottle of gram decolorizer had a loose cap allowing 1 liter of liquid to release. The bottle was in a plastic bag. No slotted partitions or absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed. Contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: Plastic bottle of gram decolorizer had a loose lid leaking out 1 liter of liquid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a hazmat bag lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023081839
item.description:
Report X-2023081839

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the damaged hazmat on the hazmat pallet in QA. I grabbed my PPE to inspect the box since there were dried up wet spots on the box at the bottom. DescribePack: I pulled all of the bottles out and noticed one bottle was missing at least 3/4 of liquid out of the 1 gallon bottle. The cap was not completely secured on the bottle, which left a bit of opening at the top of the bottle. It leaked out during transit. DurationRel: 18 and MitigateEffect: The bottles were kept upright to prevent any more leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023081823
item.description:
Report X-2023081823

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment was taken out of system flow due to the external carton wet. Package came off the trailer # 823918 from the unload, already damaged wet and leaking. The package was placed in a lined red tote to contain the leaking damaged package. The tote was then taken to the hazmat cage for further inspection. Upon inspecting the inner contents there was 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of Ethanol 140 Proof. The 1 x 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .40 gallons to release. Corrugated liner was used on the top of bottles for packing. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The 1 x 1 gallon plastic bottle of Ethanol 140 Proof had a loose cap allowing .40 gallons to release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined red tote to contain the leaking damaged package, then was taken to the hazmat cage for further inspection

item.title: Report X-2023081700
item.description:
Report X-2023081700

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-18
  • City: ZELIENOPLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Fully regulated hazmat brought to QA for inspection. Upon inspection, there were loose caps and leakage from two bottles of Hydrochloric Acid (0.0156X2.5 Gallons). A SDS was obtained for the fully regulated hazmat and proper paperwork was filed. The leaking hazmat was placed in a hazmat bag as well as a hazmat bin. The fully regulated hazmat was then brought to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: Loose caps and leakage in the amount of 4 Tablespoons (0.0156X2.5 Gallons). DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The leaking hazmat was placed in a hazmat bag as well as a hazmat bin. The fully regulated hazmat was then brought to the hazmat cage.

item.description:
Report X-2023081507

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ABF picked up a tote at a customer location and traveled to the next pick-up. When ABF arrived at the next customer location and began ~backing onto the property, the customer advised the ABF driver that the trailer was leaking. Upon opening the trailer, it was discovered ~that the tote that ABF had picked up at the previous stop was leaking. The ABF driver was unsure of the cause of the leak but advised ~that he put straps on the tote to secure it and that the strap may have damaged the tote somehow. The customer had a team of their ~workers clean the trailer and their dock. ABF contacted CUR A to send a cleaning crew for the customers yard and the side of the street ~leading to it.

item.title: Report X-2023081602
item.description:
Report X-2023081602

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-19
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of ethanol 140 proof one 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .50 gallons to release no slotted partitions bags or absorbent was found package did have cardboard liner on top of bottles facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap leaking DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote
